content.prompt: The carved decoration on the work has been interpreted as symbolic of the political power and legitimacy of the ruler based on

choices.label: a carved inscription, which lists the succession of caliphs in the Umayyad dynasty
representations of falcon eggs, which were symbolic of the Umayyad Caliphate
a portrait of the owner, which depicts him seated on an ornate throne
scenes of a lion hunt, which expresses the victory of the Umayyads over the Nasrid dynasty

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.5: Theories and Interpretations of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 7.B: Explain how one or more art historically valid interpretations of a work of art (or group of related works of art) are derived from an analysis of its form, style, materials, content, function, context, reception, and/or meaning.
